abstract.text: A background task used to receive background updates from the Watch Connectivity framework.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Don’t subclass or create instances of this class. Instead, when this background watch connectivity task is triggered, the system launches your app in the background, instantiates a
object, and passes the task object to your app delegate’s
In watchOS 9 and later, SwiftUI Background tasks are the preferred way to handle background tasks and interactions. For more information,
Background watch connectivity tasks are triggered whenever the paired device sends data using one of the following
The background watch connectivity task informs you that your app is given background time. You must use your
methods to receive this data. Because of the asynchronous nature of these tasks, defer calling your tasks’s
method until after you’ve activated your session and received all the pending data. Use the
property to determine whether you still have any pending data.

abstract.text: Runs the specified action when the system provides a background task.
The object that initiates communication between a WatchKit extension and its companion iOS app.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the session has more content to deliver.
Sends complication-related data from the iOS app to the WatchKit extension.
Sends the specified file and optional dictionary to the counterpart.
Sends the specified data dictionary to the counterpart.
Sends a dictionary of values that a paired and active device can use to synchronize its state.
A delegate protocol that defines methods for receiving messages sent by a [`WCSession`](doc://com.apple.watchconnectivity/documentation/WatchConnectivity/WCSession) object.
Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
Tells the delegate that the app has received one or more background tasks.
A task that updates your app’s state in the background.
A task for handling timely Bluetooth alerts in the background.
A background task used to update your app after a SiriKit intent runs.
The abstract superclass for WatchKit’s background task classes.
Marks the task as complete.
A background task used to periodically donate relevant Siri shortcuts.
A background task used to update your app’s user interface in preparation for a snapshot.
A task that responds to background URL sessions.
A background task used to receive background updates from the Watch Connectivity framework.
Provide a timely, accurate snapshot of your app by using snapshot background tasks.

doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/W.title: Preparing to take your watchOS app’s snapshot

abstract.text: Handle scheduled update tasks in the background, and respond to background system interactions including Siri intents and incoming Bluetooth messages.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
